classData.comment:
/**
 * Base class for all Components which have a DOM representation
 * @class Neo.component.Base
 * @extends Neo.component.Abstract
 */
classData.description: Base class for all Components which have a DOM representation
classData.name: Base

classData.comment:

/**
         * Specify a role tag attribute for the vdom root.

         * @member {String|null} role_=null
         * @reactive
         */
classData.description: Specify a role tag attribute for the vdom root. See: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA/Roles
classData.name: role_

classData.comment:
/**
         * Set this to true for style 'overflow:auto'.
         * Set this to 'x' or 'y' to add style 'overflow-x' or 'overflow-y' to 'auto'
         * Other than false this will add cls 'neo-scrollable'.
         * @member {Boolean|"x"|"y"} scrollable_=false
         * @reactive
         */
classData.description: Set this to true for style 'overflow:auto'. Set this to 'x' or 'y' to add style 'overflow-x' or 'overflow-y' to 'auto' Other than false this will add cls 'neo-scrollable'.
classData.name: scrollable_

classData.comment:
/**
         * Style attributes added to this vdom root. see: getVdomRoot()
         *
         * **Important:** When `vdom === vdomRoot` (single node component), the `wrapperStyle` mechanism
         * creates a persistent state loop to support runtime VDOM mutations.
         * This means that to *remove* a style property you previously set, you MUST set it to `null`.
         * Using `delete` or setting `undefined` will revert to the "previous state", which unfortunately
         * includes the very value you are trying to remove if it has leaked into `wrapperStyle`.
         *
         * @member {Object} style={[isDescriptor]: true, merge: 'shallow', value: null}
         */
classData.description:
Style attributes added to this vdom root. see: getVdomRoot()

Important: When vdom === vdomRoot (single node component), the wrapperStyle mechanism creates a persistent state loop to support runtime VDOM mutations. This means that to remove a style property you previously set, you MUST set it to null. Using delete or setting undefined will revert to the "previous state", which unfortunately includes the very value you are trying to remove if it has leaked into wrapperStyle.
classData.name: style

classData.comment:
/**
         * You can pass a used theme directly to any component,
         * to style specific component trees differently from your main view.
         * @member {String|null} theme_=null
         * @reactive
         */
classData.description: You can pass a used theme directly to any component, to style specific component trees differently from your main view.
classData.name: theme_

classData.comment:
/**
         * While it is recommended to define tags inside the vdom of classes,
         * this shortcut enables us to change the vdom root tag on instance level.
         * Use cases: switch a Toolbar to a "nav" tag, switch a SideNav to an "aside" tag.
         * @member {String|null} tag_=null
         * @reactive
         */
classData.description: While it is recommended to define tags inside the vdom of classes, this shortcut enables us to change the vdom root tag on instance level. Use cases: switch a Toolbar to a "nav" tag, switch a SideNav to an "aside" tag.
classData.name: tag_

classData.comment:
/**
         * The top level textContent of the component
         * @member {String|null} text_=null
         * @reactive
         */
classData.description: The top level textContent of the component
classData.name: text_

classData.comment:
/**
         * Add tooltip config object or a string containing the display text
         * See tooltip/Base.mjs
         *
         * By default, a single, shared Tooltip instance is used for all widgets that request
         * a tooltip. It reconfigures itself from the widget's definition just before showing.
         *
         * If a widget needs its own instance for any reason, include the property `ownInstance: true`
         * in the tooltip config object.
         * @member {Object|String} tooltip_=null
         * @reactive
         */
classData.description:
Add tooltip config object or a string containing the display text See tooltip/Base.mjs

By default, a single, shared Tooltip instance is used for all widgets that request a tooltip. It reconfigures itself from the widget's definition just before showing.

If a widget needs its own instance for any reason, include the property ownInstance: true in the tooltip config object.
classData.name: tooltip_

classData.comment:
/**
         * Add 'primary' and other attributes to make it an outstanding design
         * @member {String|null} ui_=null
         * @reactive

classData.description: Add 'primary' and other attributes to make it an outstanding design
classData.name: ui_

classData.name: wrapperCls_

classData.comment:
/**
         * Top level style attributes. Useful in case getVdomRoot() does not point to the top level DOM node.
         *
         * **Note:** The getter for this config reads `vdom.style` as a default value to support runtime mutations.
         * This creates the persistent state loop described in the `style_` config documentation.
         *
         * @member {Object|null} wrapperStyle_={[isDescriptor]: true, merge: 'shallow', value: null}
         * @reactive
         */
classData.description:
Top level style attributes. Useful in case getVdomRoot() does not point to the top level DOM node.

Note: The getter for this config reads vdom.style as a default value to support runtime mutations. This creates the persistent state loop described in the style_ config documentation.
classData.name: wrapperStyle_

classData.description: Triggered when accessing the wrapperCls config

classData.comment:
/**
     * Triggered when accessing the wrapperStyle config.
     *
     * It merges the current `vdom.style` into the result to ensure that runtime style mutations
     * (hacks) or initial VDOM styles are preserved and not overwritten by the config value.
     *
     * **Warning:** This creates the persistent state loop described in the `style_` config.
     * Reading the output (`vdom.style`) as the default for the input (`wrapperStyle`) means
     * merged styles become permanent unless explicitly cleared with `null`.
     *
     * @param {Object} value
     * @protected
     */
classData.description:
Triggered when accessing the wrapperStyle config.

It merges the current vdom.style into the result to ensure that runtime style mutations (hacks) or initial VDOM styles are preserved and not overwritten by the config value.

Warning: This creates the persistent state loop described in the style_ config. Reading the output (vdom.style) as the default for the input (wrapperStyle) means merged styles become permanent unless explicitly cleared with null.
classData.name: beforeGetWrapperStyle

classData.name: mergeConfig

classData.comment:
/**
     * Can get called after the component got vnodeInitialized. See the autoMount config as well.
     * We have decided to always force a new initVnode(true) call here.
     * Rationale:
     * 1. The overhead of tracking hasUnmountedVdomChanges on every vdom update is removed.
     * 2. The edge case of mounting a pre-calculated but untouched vnode tree is < 1%.
     * 3. The cost of re-generating the vnode tree is low enough to justify the robustness and simplicity.
     * 4. This ensures that the DOM is always mounted with the most up-to-date vdom state.
     */
classData.description:
Can get called after the component got vnodeInitialized. See the autoMount config as well. We have decided to always force a new initVnode(true) call here. Rationale:

  1. The overhead of tracking hasUnmountedVdomChanges on every vdom update is removed.
  2. The edge case of mounting a pre-calculated but untouched vnode tree is < 1%.
  3. The cost of re-generating the vnode tree is low enough to justify the robustness and simplicity.
  4. This ensures that the DOM is always mounted with the most up-to-date vdom state.
classData.name: mount
